in a way that relates to the study of water on the earth, for example, where it is and how it is used: The city is in a hydrologically sensitive location near the head of the valley. Lakes Michigan and Huron are hydrologically viewed as one lake that feeds Lake Erie.
More examplesFewer examplesThe mystery is why the lower lakes are in better shape, hydrologically speaking, than the upper lakes.Until recently, most people thought water at the top of the valley was hydrologically disconnected from the river.The state acts on the principle that surface water and ground water are hydrologically connected.
